poem:
Title: The Chase

Her wheels spun life, till breath was stole,
By one who traded peace for goal.
Hid in shadows, cloaked by fear,
A murderer's deceit drawn near.

Through web of words, a trick devised,
Her hunter in the open, surprised.
Siren's yoga call, baited trap,
Swift justice spanned the world map.

Odd the paths that stories mark,
Life's cruel race, death's quiet park.
